page.title: 01Tuxford Comp. School 1
page.content:
FIRST IMPRESSIONS
Tuxford Comprehensive School (M Ref E74 N7l) Adrian Mills
On the way to the Comprehensive School I saw lots of houses most of them looked fairly old. I didn't see any houses without front gardens but some of them might not have had a back garden though. I past a few shops and a doctors' surgery. Altogether the school was very large and there were some very large buildings and there were some very nice sports areas in which you could play cricket, football etc. I didn't see any mobile classrooms but there might have been some. The kitchens are very clean indeed. The size of the school is big and there are lots of games areas which
